discussion_comments.comment_body:
- `npx react-native start` is now `npx @react-native-community/cli start`, but I reckon we can omit this signal for conciseness.
- Wording tweaks.

```suggestion
      "Make sure you're running Metro or that your "
      "bundle '", assetName, "' is packaged correctly for release.\n\n"
      "The device must be on the same Wi-Fi network as your laptop to connect to Metro.\n\n"
      "To use USB instead, shake the device to open the Dev Menu and set "
      "the bundler location to \"localhost:8081\" and run:\n"
      "  adb reverse tcp:8081 tcp:8081"));
```
I think on iOS, we can enable New Arch at runtime. I don't recall if we can on Android. If so, won't this break on Android?
No, android can't disable the new arch at runtime. You can disable some pieces, but it is not recommended.
